intro: Manihot longepetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled arrowleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with long petioles, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist lowland forests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
